title: Bring SITL back to life
body: Reverted the evil commit, works again.

title: FW hardfault on beta
body:
observed on bench while setting up for a test flight

https://drive.google.com/open?id=0Bw3digSMQXDuQjR1MHJTWDNnbGM

title: gpssim: fix command line argument handling
body:
The gpssim interface was pretty broken, from random usage complaints to
segfaults.

This now allows to simulate GPS outs by doing `gpssim stop` in SITL.

title: In the SITL gazebo simu, the MAV runs away.
body: I updated the firmware on Monday then on Wednesday. However after the latest update. After running $ make posix_sitl_default gazebo, the iris does not rise up vertically. It runs away. Did I do something wrong?

title: eagle: fix DSP build
body: The hexagon-clang is clang-3.5 and does not support -fcheck-new.

title: Battery current offset got lost during refactor
body:
@julianoes 
This offset is not considered anymore: https://github.com/PX4/Firmware/blob/master/src/modules/sensors/sensors.cpp#L322, please check the version before you pulled the battery out of the sensors app.

title: External compass treated as internal first time calibrated
body: If you reboot and re-calibrate again it will calibrate as external. Seems to be recent.

title: Inspect manual control lost inspection
body: Message is coming through on switching RC back on

title: VTOL transition switch broken in current master
body:
It appears to be related to the radio settings
Transition switch is ignored (quad spins up with throttle when switch on)
Also, the pusher ESC does not initialize, or only does so after changing the VT_IDLE_PWM_MC, it does not seem to matter to what direction to change this.

@AndreasAntener @tumbili @LorenzMeier

title: px4_get_opt bug
body:
Try starting an app with wrong arguments, e.g

```
sdlog2 start -r 500 -b 20 -f
```

The -f option does not exist and the upper call will not get out of the while loop parsing the arguments.

title: fix broken windows build
body:
srcscanner.py replace windows slashes

Reported here - https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/px4users/68J1lm_X3ws

title: posix-configs: conflicting sdlog2 arguments
body:
The argument "log only when armed" was supplied but at the same time the
argument "log from startup" which were conflicting each other.

The result was that the logging started on startup but ended with
disarming. It is now changed to always on until the process is shut
down.

Tested on Snapdragon.
Needs quick testing in SITL.

title: Fix eagle build
body: Will fix compile issues after ##4437 together with 084dfb40260eb53f3f48b37a7263e5af1c7c8d02, 192510ee1c9ec34959c2284c3ee4d7cedafcfb42, 34ba80ea9d8d649ba09d328eaaf6e99f168193f9, and 2801a54544eef2d782bae5f99c8e45959c1d8c40.

title: Allow parameter culling to be turned off for SnapDragon
Takeoff/freefall/landing randomly detected while on ground
body:
Using the latest master to run 'make posix gazebo' in an Ubuntu based SITL setup.
I get very frequent warnings in commander:
TAKEOFF DETECTED
FREEFALL DETECTED
LANDING DETECTED

If I issue a 'commander arm', the auto-disarm feature nearly immediately disarms the quad because of the takeoff/freefall/landing detection.

I can work around this by modifying the rcS_gazebo_iris file from
`param set COM_DISARM_LAND 3`
to
`param set COM_DISARM_LAND 0`
but the messages are still rather annoying.

Here is a sample of the commander output:

```
...
pxh> WARN  pwm_out_sim: No valid fds
INFO  LANDING DETECTED
EKF gps is good - setting origin
INFO  home: 47.3977420, 8.5455938, 488.06
INFO  TONE_SET_ALARM 15
INFO  TONE_SET_ALARM 0
INFO  TONE_SET_ALARM 4
INFO  TONE_SET_ALARM 0
INFO  TAKEOFF DETECTED
INFO  FREEFALL DETECTED
INFO  home: 47.3977414, 8.5455949, 488.03
INFO  LANDING DETECTED
INFO  TAKEOFF DETECTED
INFO  FREEFALL DETECTED
INFO  home: 47.3977411, 8.5455944, 488.07
INFO  LANDING DETECTED
INFO  simulator is slow. Delay added: 18981 us
INFO  simulator is slow. Delay added: 34423 us
```

Here I start trying to type 'commander arm' but you can see the INFO messages are coming in too fast...

```
comINFO  TAKEOFF DETECTED
INFO  FREEFALL DETECTED
INFO  home: 47.3977411, 8.5455939, 488.17
maINFO  LANDING DETECTED
ndINFO  TAKEOFF DETECTED
INFO  FREEFALL DETECTED
INFO  home: 47.3977411, 8.5455939, 488.23
INFO  LANDING DETECTED
er arm
pxh> INFO  home: 47.3977410, 8.5455941, 488.26
INFO  TONE_SET_ALARM 6
INFO  TONE_SET_ALARM 4
INFO  TONE_SET_ALARM 0
INFO  TAKEOFF DETECTED
INFO  FREEFALL DETECTED
INFO  home: 47.3977410, 8.5455940, 488.21
INFO  LANDING DETECTED
INFO  [blackbox] stopped (0 drops)
WARN  extended logging: OFF
WARN  time: gps: 0 seconds
WARN  not logging
INFO  TAKEOFF DETECTED
INFO  FREEFALL DETECTED
INFO  home: 47.3977410, 8.5455938, 488.16
INFO  LANDING DETECTED
INFO  TAKEOFF DETECTED
INFO  FREEFALL DETECTED
INFO  home: 47.3977411, 8.5455934, 486.83
INFO  LANDING DETECTED
INFO  TAKEOFF DETECTED
INFO  FREEFALL DETECTED
INFO  home: 47.3977412, 8.5455939, 486.51
INFO  LANDING DETECTED
INFO  TAKEOFF DETECTED
INFO  FREEFALL DETECTED
INFO  home: 47.3977413, 8.5455936, 486.08
INFO  LANDING DETECTED
INFO  TAKEOFF DETECTED
INFO  FREEFALL DETECTED
INFO  home: 47.3977412, 8.5455932, 486.48
INFO  LANDING DETECTED
```

It continues like that, but you get the point.

title: muorb: call `initialize()` before `get_instance()`
body:
Recent changes to avoid race conditions made this change necessary.

Fixes #4421.

title: Snapdragon: ADSP crash on muorb/uorb init
body:
@bkueng your commit 1a57488ac68e147389050752e8b6b9bbf6620a56 unfortunately breaks for Snapdragon.

It looks like https://github.com/PX4/Firmware/blob/1a57488ac68e147389050752e8b6b9bbf6620a56/src/modules/uORB/uORBManager.hpp#L76 returns `nullptr` in https://github.com/PX4/Firmware/blob/1a57488ac68e147389050752e8b6b9bbf6620a56/src/modules/muorb/adsp/px4muorb.cpp#L55, presumably because `initialize()` is never called on the Linux side.

title: sdlog2 bugfix of vehicle_status conflicting with commander_state
body:
This fixes a bug where vehicle_system_status and the commander internal
state were conflicting.

~~This will need adaptations in logging tools.
The change for FlightPlot is here: https://github.com/DrTon/FlightPlot/pull/62~~

title: sensors: the ifdef logic was inverted
body: Sorry my bad. I should have not have merged this change without testing earlier.

title: sensors: treat RPi like QURT
body: This is another try to fix #4383.

title: sensors: use the empty sensor init for RPi as well
body:
The RPi build is based on the same DriverFramework base like the QURT
build, therefore it should use the same empty sensor init function.

This could fix #4383.

title: initialize offboard structs
body:
Fixes the resetting yaw rate setpoint bug (initialization pos_sp_triplet does, the other two are preemptive).

The problem was the disable_mc_yaw_control flag, checks resulted to true.

title: param_shmem: fix bug where params didn't stick
body:
There was the case where a param was changed on the Linux side but the
change did not get saved on the DSP side because the param was not in
the local list of changed params on the DSP side. On save, the param
index is now refreshed, and param_get is called on all params that have
changed. This is a hacky workaround but resolves the problem for now.

Tested on Snapdragon, none of the changes are affecting anything non-Snapdragon.

Resolves #4356.

body:
Fixes:

```
Firmware/src/modules/mavlink/mavlink_messages.cpp: In constructor 'MavlinkStreamStatustext::MavlinkStreamStatustext(Mavlink*)':
Firmware/src/modules/mavlink/mavlink_messages.cpp:387:2: error: class 'MavlinkStreamStatustext' does not have any field named 'fp'
  fp(nullptr)
```

Let's wait for travis to merge.

title: mag_calibration: bugfix for device ID of mag
body:
The device ID is defined as a uint32_t in the driver and topic but
stored as a int32_t param. It is therefore sufficient if the device ID
is not 0 in order to be valid.

This should resolve #4342.

@mhkabir and @ndepal: can you test if the compass calibration works for you with this fix?

title: FW stabalized mode properly initialize att_sp
body:
In fixed wing stabilized mode the ECL integrators were being constantly reset. The attitude setpoint published in fw_att_control during stabilized mode wasn't initialized and att_sp.pitch_reset_integral was interpreted as set.

I discovered this after a rather spectacular crash 30s after takeoff.

title: Snapdrogon Driver fix PWM commands
body:
This should resolve `pwm: PWM_SERVO_SET(0): Invalid argument` observed in #4316.

This also enables `snapdragon_rc_pwm` to be stopped.

title: Passthrough mode for Snapdragon on PixFalcon fails to output PWM
body:
I am using a PixFalcon in passthrough mode to control the ESCs with the Snapdragon flight.
The PixFalcon refuses to talk to the ESCs, which beep every few seconds as a result.

I am seeing this on the current master (af02b860b3cc495f67a879088dca9f8b1edd58f9) with the following procedure:
Flash the firmware to the PixFalcon
`make px4fmu-v2_default upload`
With the SD card out, connect to the NuttShell. Set a normal airframe and reboot:

```
param set SYS_AUTOSTART 10020
reboot
```

Once rebooted, re-connect, press the safety switch and test the PWM:

```
pwm test -c 1 -p 1200
```

The motor turns, the ESCs are quiet.
Set the passthrough airframe and reboot (via the nsh command, **not** power-cycling):

```
param set SYS_AUTOSTART 20000
reboot
```

Re-connect and test the PWM (safety switch not required)

```
pwm test -c 1 -p 1200
```

The motor turns, the ESCs are quiet. If I `reboot`, the PixFalcon's LED will now light up purple instead of blinking blue, but `pwm test` still works.

As soon as I power-cycle, `pwm test` no longer works (and neither does `snapdragon_rc_pwm`).
After stopping `pwm test` with `Ctrl-C` I get the following message:

```
pwm: PWM_SERVO_SET(0): Invalid argument
```

I see the same output printed in [`snapdragon_rc_pwm`](https://github.com/PX4/Firmware/blob/2f48317a9ea7b05d8c61b3d1c44f8229491350b1/src/drivers/snapdragon_rc_pwm/snapdragon_rc_pwm.cpp#L209), where `ret == -1` and `errno == 22`.

```
PX4 CONFIG: posix_eagle_default
Scanning dependencies of target upload

make[2]: *** [src/firmware/posix/CMakeFiles/upload.dir/rule] Error 2
make[1]: *** [upload] Error 2

Add Comment Collapse
```

It works up to 5211da9f5b56dd140930051a2fcbe826d20a2755. The next one, e904184, produces lots of CMake errors. The following commit, 1692590, and all newer ones produce the above error.

title: bad bytes in log
body:
`make px4fmu-v2_default upload`
completed successfully to a Pixhawk.

Executed
`sdlog2 stop`
`sdlog2 start -t -r 200 -e -b 16`
`sdlog2 stop`
at the nsh prompt

Moved the logfile to my computer and dumped with mavlogdump.py, gave
`Skipped 74 bad bytes in log (73, 78, 70) remaining=496769`
`Skipped 74 bad bytes in log (73, 78, 70) remaining=496769`
`1969-12-31 16:00:00.02: FMT {Type : 2, Length : 55, Name : ATT, Format : fffffffffffff, Columns : qw,qx,qy,qz,Roll,Pitch,Yaw,RollRate,PitchRate,YawRate,GX,GY,GZ}`
etc.

Opening in FlightPlot fails with a FormatErrorException: Invalid header at 1 (0x1)

[log001.zip](https://github.com/PX4/Firmware/files/218102/log001.zip)

title: dronekit and modes from pymavlink
body:
I have received an increased number of requests to look into the PX4 integration in DroneKit, one of the problems that is bugging people is that we are facing a mode problem when connecting

```
`>>> Exception in message handler for HEARTBEAT
```

DroneKit is using the [`mode_mapping_bynumber` helper from **mavutil.py**](https://github.com/mavlink/mavlink/blob/master/pymavlink/mavutil.py#L1416-L1433) and we seem to be facing modes not defined there.

I don't have much much time to spend debugging this I'm looking for help from the PX4 community, there are plenty issues on our dronekit repo but this should be the official

https://github.com/dronekit/dronekit-python/issues/606

body:

side on Snapdragon. It's a hack until there is a proper fix for the
orb_exists() call.

title: only use the default acceptance radius for checking mission feasibility

milestone.title: Release v1.3.0
milestone.description: This release will include full support for Pixhawk, Pixhawk 2, Eagle and NAVIO+.

body:
Using the acceptance radius from the navigator blocks a mission upload for VTOLs while in fixed-wing flight because takeoff altitude is most likely smaller than the current acceptance radius from the nav caps.

SITL tested

title: Can't compile for gazebo on Mac
body:
I tried to follow the steps in the devguide to get the gazebo sim working on Mac OS X10.11.4.

Unfortunately `make posiz gazebo` fails to compile as follows:

```
Scanning dependencies of target rotors_gazebo_motor_model
In file included from /Users/julianoes/src/Firmware/Tools/sitl_gazebo/src/gazebo_opticalFlow_plugin.cpp:24:
```

title: Fix Snapdragon param save
body:
If a param is set in QGC for Snapdragon, it doesn't get saved correctly.

There seemed to be two bugs:
- The param were not updated from shmem before saving.
- The set and save command sent by QGC seem to lead to a race. Somehow the save command will get executed first (or too early) on the DSP side, therefore saving the old param instead of the newly set one.

This has been tested on the Snapdragon and should not touch anything else, so it's good to be merged once the checks pass.

@mcharleb, @jywilson FYI

This should resolve https://github.com/mavlink/qgroundcontrol/issues/3120.

title: Fix calibration messages in QGC
body:
This should fix #4158.

Only tested on Pixhawk connected over USB. Needs cross-testing on Pixracer over Wifi.

title: cmake: don't mess with git submodules everywhere
body:
It's enough to have the check_submodules.sh script. The rest needs to
go.

title: DriverFramework: update submodule
body: This fixes a bug where the mainapp on Snapdragon uses 100% CPU.

title: sdlog2: fixed wrong memset
body: This triggered a compile error in the POSIX build.

title: GPIO issues on PX4FMUv1
body:
Hi

I'm trying to use GPIOs on the old PX4FMUv1 (the ones on the 15 pin connector designated "MULTI" on the schematics, GPIO_EXT1 / GPIO_EXT2). I had this working on a quite old version of the firmware  (not yet using cmake), but I recently switched to the newest stable version. Ever since, I'm not able to use those GPIOs anymore.

I'm starting the fmu app in mode_serial, which worked before.

Is there anybody using GPIOs on the old FMUv1 but with a recent FW version?

Also the gpio_led app in the default fw does not work on a FMUv1, while it works on the FMUv2.

Any hints are very much appreciated!

body:
Based on user report

body:
When executing a just uploaded mission, sometimes, the takeoff tries to move laterally towards a waypoint. I have seen this behavior in SITL too. Rebooting solves the problem.
I think it happens when having armed it and then upload a new mission

I will try to find a log and also try to reproduce.

title: Ekf2 does not publish control state airspeed
body: All logic in PX4 which depends on control state is not working with ekf2 at the moment.

title: log both actuator groups 0 and 1 again
body:
sdlog replay stuff broke this zzz :)
Fixes #4080

title: DriverFramework: update submodule
body:
This lowers the MPU9250 sampling rate from 1kHz to 500 Hz.

This should lower the risk of getting timeouts because pthread_cond_timedwait() does never return.

For more info:
https://github.com/PX4/DriverFramework/pull/49
https://github.com/PX4/DriverFramework/pull/48

title: Add "external" flag to mag report message
body:
Currently sensors doesn't know if a mag is external and therefore needs to be rotated.

This needs to be added the the mag report message in the same way the device ID has been added.

title: Ekf2 replay possible broken
body: I need to try this with new replay log but with logs from not too long ago I just get timeout warnings form the replay module which means that it's not getting any data from the estimator.

title: Snapdragon local pos z weird
body: I can provide a log where the local position shoots up to about 200m in the first seconds of the log.

title: Snapdragon: muORB doesn't properly support orb_exist

milestone.title: Release v1.6.0
milestone.description: The main novelty of this release is a massive NuttX update adding support for STM32F7 and fault logging.

title: sdlog2 fixes
body: This fixes #4108, as well as a second bug where `sdlog2 start` without more arguments would cause a segfault.

title: Snapdragon/SITL: mainapp can crash on disarm
body:
Sometimes, maybe 1/5 times. I disarm and get:

```
*** Error in `./mainapp': double free or corruption (fasttop): 0xb4800468 ***
Aborted
```

title: Fix mavlink broadcast
body:
This fixes the broadcast issue that we've seen on Snapdragon if it was configured in AP mode.
See #3939.

Tested on Snapdragon and POSIX gazebo.

title: WIP: VTOL roll trim
body:
This adds a roll trim param to combat roll produced by the inertia of the pusher prop.
Also, the scaling was removed for roll and pitch during transition in order to correctly apply these values.

With this param, and the already existing pitch trim the climbing and rolling during transition can be corrected. The roll trim will have to be set depending on the rotation direction of the pusher / puller. In SITL the following values produce a stable result;
VT_FW_PITCH_TRIM: -0.25
VT_FW_ROLL_TRIM: 0.25

The MC, during transition blending does not have enough authority to correct roll and pitch and the FW is not yet in control to apply these corrections.

Setting the above values fixes https://github.com/PX4/Firmware/issues/4079
Airframes should independently be analyzed for correct values.
Roll should be set positive CCW pusher prop and negative with a CW pusher prop
Pitch (in all the logs i have seen) always seems to angle up and therefor needs a negative value

I'm not sure if this is a permanent solution or if we should revisit the control authority of MC/FW during transitions.

@AndreasAntener @tumbili @LorenzMeier

title: sdlog issues
body:
- OUT1 logged with OUT0 values
- strange uint8 values

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/14801663/14055189/000219b6-f2e0-11e5-8494-715ffdeb037c.png)

title: Various Snapdragon hotfixes
body:
This is a small collection of hotfixes for Snapdragon issues:
- build the land_detector
- remove the rc_receiver from the startup script
- add a log path for on the aDSP but put it between defines

title: param_shmem: fix the "unknown param id" bug
body:
The recent workaround to flag all params as used did not include
param_for_used_index(). However, this function got used in the case if
one param had not been received by QGC and was requested by its index.

title: hmc5883 reports buffer overflow
body:
There seems to be an error in the perf reporting of the hmc5883 for the external mag.

```
hmc5883_buffer_overflows: 11315 events
```

@sanderux FYI

title: Revert "px4flow: disable distance data transmission from px4flow sensor"
body:
This reverts commit 47f79a66d146e9be8a914aa5918aaef934eb618d because it
was just an intermediate debug commit.

Thanks @jgoppert for bringing this up.

title: Fix parameters on Snapdragon
df_hmc5883_wrapper: fix mag rotation
body: The external GPS+Mag needs some rotation.

title: Make all params used on Snapdragon
body:
This is a workaround for the fact that the used information is not
shared between the ADSP and the Linux side on the Snapdragon. By
flagging all params used, we can at least receive them on QGC.

title: snapdragon params not being retrieved in QGC
body:
have not investigated yet, so not sure where this is failing but params are not being retrieved when the vehicle connects.

my setup is slightly non-standard in that I have hard coded my host machine's IP into `_src_addr` in `mavlink_main.cpp` and set `_src_addr_initialized = true;` to prevent subsequent broadcast's from going out. otherwise, communication with QGC appears normal.

cc @julianoes

title: DriverFramework: update submodule
body: This should fix includes, as well as the gyro scaling.

title: PX4 UM: Parameters Refference

labels.name: Documentation 📑
labels.description: Anything improving the documentation of the code / ecosystem

milestone.title: Release v1.6.0
milestone.description: The main novelty of this release is a massive NuttX update adding support for STM32F7 and fault logging.

body:
Hello,

I'm writing the UM of PX4 and I have the following problem. Somebody depreciated all the old docs and Index from pixhawk.org. The index page is still available but it is hidden. 

So it is a very good Idea if somebody from the core team can implement the Parameters reference page in the new Users Manual tree in the Advanced Configuration Section. 

https://pixhawk.org/firmware/parameters

It is automatically generated so I cannot create it. It is madness if I have to manually change the Parameters Reference Page when new parameters are added in the development process.

Thanks

title: SENS_FLOW_ROT parameter does not work

milestone.title: Release v1.3.0
milestone.description: This release will include full support for Pixhawk, Pixhawk 2, Eagle and NAVIO+.

body: The SENS_FLOW_ROT parameter used to allow for different installation angles for the PX4Flow sensor does not correct the published values.

title: mavlink UDP broadcast doesn't work on Snapdragon

milestone.title: Release v1.3.0
milestone.description: This release will include full support for Pixhawk, Pixhawk 2, Eagle and NAVIO+.

body:
Currently, the UDP broadcast of a mavlink instance running on the Linux side on the Snapdragon fails.

This needs investigation.

title: High vibration alert but no clip count bump in VIBRATION message
body: If the firmware is triggering a high vibration alert shouldn't it also be bumped one or more of the x/y/z clip count values in the VIBRATION message?

title: VTOL RTL with landing in FW lands diagonally

milestone.title: Release v1.3.0
milestone.description: This release will include full support for Pixhawk, Pixhawk 2, Eagle and NAVIO+.

body:
because it will transition to MC somewhere along the loiter circle, then start to land at home. But unlike missions it won't first shift the landing location (home).

Solution to keep the way it currently works:
Add 2 new states in RTL after LOITER that will only be used for VTOLs:
- back transition
- move to land

A simpler solution, but changes the behaviour:
- 1 new state: back transition before loiter

Maybe we even want both options. And the user can select.

title: Adjust Pitch Sensitivity in QGC caused large twitch then recover
body:
- Flying 250 PixRacer
- Hovering in PosCtl
- Wanted to adjust Pitch Sensitivity to make vehicle less twitchy
- Slid the slider a slot to the right
- Vehicle did a large mid-air twitch then recovered

Quite disconcerting

title: Mission: DO_JUMP sends MISSION_ITEM to ground station
body:
- QGC + SITL
- Create mission with an infinite loop do jump
- Start mission

When the vehicle hits the DO_JUMP it correctly justs but the firmware sends a MISSION_ITEM message to QGC which cause QGC to pop an error since you aren't supposed to get one of these for no reason.

title: VTOL: No PWM signal to aux ports on current master
body:
On current master the pusher ESC does not initialize and after switching to FW (disarmed) the servos do not respond. The servo's also do not go to initial position at boot. The MC does arm at this point.

It seems like there is no signal going to the aux outputs

title: MC: RTL "climb" phase during mission keeps current item location

milestone.title: Release v1.3.0
milestone.description: This release will include full support for Pixhawk, Pixhawk 2, Eagle and NAVIO+.

body: It should reset to the current location

title: Yaw setpoint from manual can be kept when switching to auto
body:
To reproduce:
- have a mission with takeoff wp (30m)
- manual, hover at some altitude (5m)
- full yaw
- switch to mission during yaw

It will then keep yawing slowly during the mission flight (and do a nice pirouette)
http://logs.uaventure.com/view/wqG48Vi97iHGiKfNeWWymN

title: RC switches are not considered updated on UORB at boot (flight mode, vtol transition, etc)

milestone.title: Release v1.3.0
milestone.description: This release will include full support for Pixhawk, Pixhawk 2, Eagle and NAVIO+.

body: You can boot with the transition switch in FW mode, but it will ignore this and arm in MC mode. Only after you flick the switch forth and back it will switch to FW

title: No RC control when in failsafe
body:
Here's a log from a (vtol) flight that went into failsafe due to low  battery voltage (it was set a bit too high).
http://logs.uaventure.com/view/3msrKYiSjKrDvKKckveA4e

The as there was no autoland engaged the plane went into loiter.
I was unable to retake control of the plane by switching the mode switch on the RC, i had to switch the mode on the GCS to regain control

```
make[1]: *** No rule to make target 'posix_rpi2_release'.  Stop.
Makefile:147: recipe for target 'posix_sitl_default' failed
```

title: Wrong function definition
body:
Dear, 

There is a inconsistency between .h & .cpp for the `position_estimator_inav` module between the `inertial_filter.h` & `inertial_filter.cpp` files.

Indeed, the x[] data is defined as x[3] in the [header](https://github.com/PX4/Firmware/blob/4b659f199560e2f7213428d3d13a7d9f570f47bf/src/modules/position_estimator_inav/inertial_filter.h#L11-L13) and x[2] in the code [here](https://github.com/PX4/Firmware/blob/4b659f199560e2f7213428d3d13a7d9f570f47bf/src/modules/position_estimator_inav/inertial_filter.cpp#L12) and [here](https://github.com/PX4/Firmware/blob/4b659f199560e2f7213428d3d13a7d9f570f47bf/src/modules/position_estimator_inav/inertial_filter.cpp#L24)

title: Problems before or after arming
body:
Since a while we have issues with arming or before arming. I'd say 1 out of 5 boots, maybe less.

There are 2 symptoms:
- IO_ARM_DENIED (see px4io status below)
- it arms but props don't spin up: http://logs.uaventure.com/view/u4vCAaB9uiza9ALDetymKn

I observed this on our Fun Cub and on our F450

I know it's not much to go for right now. Maybe we can try to record some additional info if this happens again?
